gurmukhi: ਕਾਨਨ ਮੈ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਕੀ ਸੁਨਿ ਬਾਤ ਰਿਸਾਤ ਚਲਿਓ ਚੜ੍ਹਿ ੳੂਪਰਿ ਗੈ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Kaanan Mai Nrip Koo Soun(i) Baat Risaat Chadio Chadh(i) Oopar(i) Gadkai||
translation: Hearing the words of the king with own ears, Raktabvija riding on his elephant and in great fury, marched away.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨੋ ਪ੍ਰਤੱਛ ਹੋੲਿ ਅੰਤਕ ਦੰਤ ਕੋ ਲੈ ਕੈ ਚਲਿਓ ਰਨ ਹੇਤ ਜੁ ਛੈ ਕੈ ||੧੨੬||
transliteration: Maano Pratachchh Hoe Antak Dant Ko Lai Kai Chadio Ran Het Ju Chhai Kai||126||
translation: It seemed that the Yama, manifesting himself is taking the demon to his destruction by fighting in the battlefield.126.

gurmukhi: ਬੀਜ ਰਕਤ੍ਰ ਸੁ ਬੰਬ ਬਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਅਾਗੈ ਕੀੲੇ ਗਜ ਬਾਜ ਰਥੲੀਅਾ ||
transliteration: Booj Raktra Su Banb Bajaae Kai Aagad Kooe Gad Baaj Rathaooaa||
translation: The trumpet was sounded by Raktavija who sent forward his forces on elephants, horses and chariots.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਤੇ ੲੇਕ ਮਹਾਂ ਬਲਿ ਦਾਨਵ ਮੇਰ ਕੋ ਪਾੲਿਨ ਸਾਥ ਮਥੲੀਅਾ ||
transliteration: Ek Te Ek Mahaan Bal(i) Daanav Mer Ko Paain Saath Mathaooaa||
translation: All those demons are very powerful, who can even crush Sumeru with their feet.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖ ਤਿਨੈ ਸੁਭ ਅੰਗ ਸੁ ਦੀਰਘ ਕੳੁਚ ਸਜੇ ਕਟ ਬਾਂਧਿ ਭਥੲੀਅਾ ||
transliteration: Dekh(i) Tinai Soubh An Su Dooragh Kaouch Saje Kat Baandh(i) Bhathaooaa||
translation: Their bodies and limbs look very strong and large, on which they are wearing the armour, with quivers tied with their waists.

gurmukhi: ਲੀਨੇ ਕਮਾਨਨ ਬਾਨ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਨ ਸਮਾਨ ਕੈ ਸਾਥ ਲੲੇ ਜੁ ਸਥੲੀਅਾ ||੧੨੭||
transliteration: Loone Kamaanan Baan Kridaan Samaan Kai Saath Lae Ju Sathaooaa||127||
translation: Raktavija is going with his companions wearing their weapons like bows, arrows, swords etc. alongwith all other paraphernalia.127.

gurmukhi: ਰਕਤ ਬੀਜ ਦਲ ਸਾਜ ਕੈ ੳੁਤਰੇ ਤਟ ਗਿਰ ਰਾਜ ||
transliteration: Rakat Booj Dal Saaj Kai Outre Tat Gir Raaj||
translation: Raktavija, keeping his army in array, encamped at the base of sumeru.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਵਣ ਕੁਲਾਹਲ ਸੁਨਿ ਸਿਵਾ ਕਰਿਓ ਜੁੱਧ ਕੋ ਸਾਜ ||੧੨੮||
transliteration: Sravan Kulaahal Soun(i) Sivaa Kario Juddh Ko Saaj||128||
translation: Hearing their tumult with her ears, the goddess prepared for war.128.

gurmukhi: ਹੁੲਿ ਸਿੰਘਹਿ ਅਸਵਾਰ ਗਾਜ ਗਾਜ ਕੈ ਚੰਡਕਾ ||
transliteration: Hue Singhah(i) Asvaar Gadj Gadj Kai Channdakaa||
translation: Riding on her lion, Chandika, shouting ludly;

gurmukhi: ਚਲੀ ਪ੍ਰਬਲ ਅਸ ਧਾਰ ਰਕਤਿ ਬੀਜ ਕੇ ਬਧ ਨਮਿਤ ||੧੨੯||
transliteration: Chaloo Prabal As Dhaar Rakat(i) Booj Ke Badh Namoond||129||
translation: Marched holding her mightly sword in order to kill Raktvija.129.
